      • completeConfiguration

        public IndexDescriptor completeConfiguration​(IndexDescriptor index)
        Description copied from interface: IndexConfigCompleter
        Since indexes can now have provider-specific settings and configurations, the provider needs to have an opportunity to inspect and validate the index descriptor before an index is created. The provider also uses this opportunity to assign capabilities to the index. The returned descriptor is a version of the given descriptor which has a fully fleshed out configuration, and is what must be used for creating an index.

        Note that this is an additive and idempotent operation. If an index is already configured, then this method must not overwrite the existing configuration.

        Specified by:
        completeConfiguration in interface IndexConfigCompleter
        Parameters:
        index - The descriptor of an index that we are about to create, and we wish to its configuration be completed by its chosen index provider.
        Returns:
        An index descriptor with a completed configuration.

      • getCapability

        private IndexCapability getCapability​(IndexDescriptor index)

      • getPopulationFailure

        public String getPopulationFailure​(IndexDescriptor descriptor,
                                   PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Description copied from class: IndexProvider
        Returns a failure previously gotten from IndexPopulator.markAsFailed(String) Implementations are expected to persist this failure
        Specified by:
        getPopulationFailure in class IndexProvider
        Parameters:
        descriptor - IndexDescriptor of the index.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer
        Returns:
        failure, in the form of a stack trace, that happened during population or empty string if there is no failure

      • getInitialState

        public InternalIndexState getInitialState​(IndexDescriptor index,
                                          PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Description copied from class: IndexProvider
        Called during startup to find out which state an index is in. If InternalIndexState.FAILED is returned then a further call to IndexProvider.getPopulationFailure(IndexDescriptor, PageCursorTracer) is expected and should return the failure accepted by any call to IndexPopulator.markAsFailed(String) call at the time of failure.
        Specified by:
        getInitialState in class IndexProvider
        Parameters:
        index - to get initial state for.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer.
